thread.title: Royals fans roll out their superstitions for game five
thread.title_full: Royals fans roll out their superstitions for game five - KCTV5

author: Dave Eckert, Assignment Editor
title: Royals fans roll out their superstitions for game five
text:
KANSAS CITY, MO (KCTV) - Everyone know sports is full of superstitions, but perhaps no sport has more of them than baseball.
From rally hats to the outfit you wear to where you watch or listen to the game, baseball fans are rife with superstitions.
Here's what one fan was going when the Royals were losing to the Astros on Monday.
"I was sitting there with my dog in the basement. He has a little hair that looks like a tornado, so I decided if I did it clockwise theyâ€™d do well, so I kept rubbing and they got a hit then another hit," Royals fan Jeff Patton told us.
We don't know how the dog felt about all the rubbing, but whatever works, right?
One of our Facebook friends is wearing her lucky Royals shirt, saying "They've won every time I've had this on."
Our digital content manager is.wearing special Royals garb too, though she wouldn't tell us what significance her shirt has because she afraid she would jinx things. Uh huh.
Other fans take their superstitions to even greater heights. We found a local astrologist who's also a Royals fan.
Quan Tracy Cherry studies supernatural forces and the Royals from time to time.
Cherry says the stars are aligned for a great pitching performance from Johnny Cueto as long as Cueto maintains his composure. (Pretty spot on).
"He has the need for physical control. So any distractions that get him out of what I call the 'jiggling rocking chair,' you have to go into that focused sense of keeping physical control of his own rhythm," Cherry said.
Um, okay. By the way, Cherry was holding a tiger during the interview because Cueto was born in the year of the tiger.
So, wear your lucky hat, tee-shirt, or jersey, watch the game on the right television with the right people, and drink whatever you drink to bring home a Royals victory. Like we said, whatever works.
